channel.title: Black Mesa Facility
channel.description: With the release of HL Decay PC i have since grabbed all the overviews for the levels, but am still having some difficulty putting them all together so this overview is not the final version im afraid but its getting pretty close :smiley: [url=https://www.ensys-games.com/album/albums/uploads/overview3.png]Behold[/url]

item.title: Black Mesa Facility
item.dc:creator: skyms2663
item.description:
I’m almost certain fair few people will complain about some maps overlapping.

I for one wouldn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Facility
item.dc:creator: Mangled
item.description:
Raminator:

We’ve got better things to do than rearrange the entire game to make sure it doesn’t overlap.

… you surprise me. :3

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Facility
item.dc:creator: Darkreaper
item.description:
well the levels from residue processing onwards are organized thanks to the level setups from later games, that how i was able to get everything lined up like it should be. Was thinking of using autocad to work out a 3d representation of the entire facility, which is why i recorded the vertical heights of each map when i was making this overview.
What ive heard from the BMS guys is that theyre trying to organize the levels in such a way that makes more sense with possibly no overlaps, so one can only hope

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Facility
item.dc:creator: Mangled
item.description:
Someone should do this in 3D… totally possible in Hammer but also completely confusing because I can only presume there will be areas that are in exactly the same space.

I wonder what Black Mesa’s rendition of Black Mesa will look like in full overview. :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.description:
no, this is Black Mesa from Half-Life only. Note how the levels overlap and nothing makes sense.

Black Mesa from HL Only

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Facility
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
Darkreaper:

well hardly see how the many overlaps are really my fault, personally i find it kind of funny, i mean how did you expect to make so many left turns and not end up where you started. Overview overlap is just one of the funny quirks of level design.
And as for the overlaps its not really a big deal with the exception of the surface levels in which case yeah, they do overlap a lot and its pretty bad. Ironically you cover more ground in the opening train ride (in the sense of net distance) than you do in the rest of the game (probably because of all those left turns)
But without adding in the gearbox overviews itd be impossible to tie the whole thing together, need i remind you, you are knocked unconcious at one point…

I don’t see where anyone said it was your fault.

Read full topic
